intro: Blephariglottis psycodes f. ecalcarata, commonly known as the scarlet bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The species features showy, bright red to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. This plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats.
